sub_title: Would You Like to Rebuild Your Life After Divorce? Overcome Your Limiting Beliefs and Empower You to Live with Passion & Purpose. | Divorce | Relationship | Life Coach
summary:
Individual Life Coaching, e-books, freebies.

Online Program:
"The DIVORCEE's CONFIDENCE BLUEPRINT for Rebuilding an EXTRAORDINARY LIFE" https://sylwia-borowys.mastermind.com/masterminds/33251. 

😄 YOU CAN 
➣ Make changes in your life. 
➣ Feel more positive energy & encouragement to take on your challenges. 
➣ Have more passion & joy in life. 
 
✅  WHO BENEFITS 
 ➣ People who want to improve their personal or professional relationships.
 ➣ People who want to improve their self esteem & self confidence, & find more excitement in their lives. 
 ➣ Women who are struggling to be happy, strong and confident again after a breakup or divorce.

👉 HOW WE WORK
 ➣ Together we create a clear vision of your life and find the purpose. 
 ➣  I help you figure out what's most important to you. 
 ➣  We brainstorm numerous ways how to get there according to your values and beliefs. 
 ➣  With my help you rediscover your strengths, passions, & potential. 
 ➣  I help you transform negative patterns into positive ones, & eliminate distractions that prevent you from accomplishing your goals. 

😇TESTIMONIAL
"Sylwia is one of the most amazing people I have met. She is always full of joy and so passionate in transforming lives. She is very committed to her work and also serving others with an open heart."

👍  WHY COACHING with SYLWIA
Those who met me describe me as a person with lots of positive energy & full of joy. I share those values with my clients. I come from Poland. I have lived in the Netherlands, Brazil & Mexico for the past 23 years. Living expat life taught me that life is a journey full of surprises. I am passionate about helping people, seeing their transformations, & feeling more excitement on a daily basis. I am curious. I empower  people & make them laugh.

😎 DEVELOPMENT & MOTIVATION
I have always been interested in learning and growing. I earned my master’s in economics. As a risk analyst at ING Bank for years and as a chess player, I approach challenges in life in an analytical way. My life experiences motivated me to change my career path from banking into coaching. I see opportunities everywhere. 

Grab your FREE guide https://newomancoaching.com/how-to-be-happy-and-strong-again-2/ - click the link in the “Featured.”

📞 TALK TO ME
If you want to believe in yourself, have more joy in life and great relationships, book a FREE discovery call with me here https://newomancoaching.com/contact/ or send me a DM.
==============================

I can assure you that already after our first talk you will feel empowered. The decision is yours.

treasury_media.title: Passion | Purpose | Sylwia Borowy | NeWoman
treasury_media.description:
Here are some of the topics we talked about:
•  Embrace that you are different.
•  Do things with passion.
•  When people offer you help, take it, and ask for help.
•  Be grateful for all your experiences.
•  Love yourself
•  Take on new challenges. 
•  Focus on your strengths.
•  Live in the moment.
•  Don't give up your career when your children are born.

•  In the relationship both partners have to grow, personally and professionally. 
•  Sometimes, we need only one person who believes in us

treasury_media.title: Shattering the Glass Ceiling! 4 featuring Sylwia Borowy
treasury_media.description: Sylwia Borowy guests on Shattering the Glass Ceiling! live Thursdays at 1:30 pm PST on Rainier Avenue Radio with life-changing conversations that unite remarkable women and men from all walks of life to share and exchange individual experiences hosted...

treasury_media.title: Get Back Your Confidence & Rebuild Your Life After Divorce - for Women
treasury_media.description: If you're a woman after 40 going through a divorce or breakup, and you're longing and you’re ready to be as your most confident, strong, beautiful self, and truly happy as you were before you got married, without spending countless hours and money on therapy, you've come to the right place. Welcome! Here is the link to join my INDIVIDUAL online program https://sylwia-borowys.mastermind.com/masterminds/33251

treasury_media.title: How to be Happy and Strong again. Free guide | NeWoman
treasury_media.description: Three years ago my world turned upside down when my marriage ended after almost 20 years. I was devastated. I had to find self-love and I did it. I created inner happiness, I discovered my strengths, and I found a new purpose in life. As a Life Coach I help those who need me. Grab the guide and if you need to talk, book a discovery call with me.

treasury_media.title: 30 Minute FREE Discovery Session with Sylwia Borowy
treasury_media.description: I welcome you to sign up for a free 30 minute clarity session call meeting with me. I offer a certain amount of free clarity sessions every week. No obligation. Warm regards, Sylwia

treasury_media.title: How to Get Over a Breakup & be Happy Again in 5 Simple Steps in 3 Months
treasury_media.description: Have you become single again after a divorce or breakup, and you are feeling totally down - your world turned upside down? If so, this eBook is for you. It describes the “must to experience” stages of a breakup. You will also recognize whether you are an insecure woman jumping into a rebound relationship. You will find out the benefits of being single, yet, in order to attract love you truly want. I will walk you through 5 steps how to be happy and strong again in 3 months. I did it!

treasury_media.title: Is Your Relationship on the Rocks? Find out the Red Flags here!
treasury_media.description:
How often do we see signs that something is not right in our relationship, and yet, we ignore them? In fact, we accept them. And then, one day, the relationship ends, totally unexpectedly. 
In this eBook you will learn about the differences between His and Her needs and also communication styles.

treasury_media.title: Candid Conversation with Sylwia Borowy
treasury_media.description: How I rediscovered myself and found a new purpose in life. It is never too late to start something new.

treasury_media.title: How I turned my struggles into my strengths - my story and 3 key steps to inner happiness - no matter what.
treasury_media.description: Episode 8 of Get Set to Thrive Podcast is live NOW❗️ This week, we have Sylwia Borowy - Divorce and Relationship Coach Sylwia helps women after a breakup... Interview by Michele Gunn and Shreyas Koushik

profile_positions.description:
When my marriage ended in 2017 after almost 20 years together, I was completely devastated. Coaching helped me enormously and then I decided to help others, especially women who are going through a breakup or divorce, and who are struggling to rebuild their lives, their self-esteem, their self-confidence, and be beautiful true to themselves. I know I can help YOU!

I also help my clients take on challenges in various areas of their lives.

During our one-to-one sessions, either online or offline, I help my clients rediscover their strengths, passions, potential, find their purpose in life in order to achieve their personal goals, according to their values and beliefs. I guide them how to live more joyful and happier every day. 

I help them improve their relationships, either with their partner, in-laws, employees, their boss, or others. And I help them boost their self-esteem and self-confidence, and find more excitement in life. 

I also give workshops. Whenever I have an opportunity, I host events either on personal or professional development. 

Please send me a DM if you would like to know if and how I can help you.
profile_positions.title: CERTIFIED LIFE COACH (divorce, relationships, self-esteem, self-confidence, purpose in life, joy)

profile_positions.description: It was a volunteering position with other amazing coaches in various area of life. Unfortunately, the project has ended.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: In this department I was analyzing various data quality issues in the system Vortex whether they were in line with ING internal policies. I was following up with ING branches globally whether there were any discrepancies. For that reason we organized regular audio conferences in order to discuss various issues and solve them. I was also monitoring any concentrations and trends in the credit portfolio. This was my last position at ING, and for the next decade, because we left for Brazil, and then Mexico, to pursue the career of my husband, and I became a full time mom.
profile_positions.title: Senior Credit Portfolio Risk Analyst

profile_positions.description: I was analyzing and assessing transactions from country / transfer risk point of view in emerging markets. I was responsible for Asia, Middle East, and for couple of months also Latin America. I loved this job a lot - there were many very complex transactions - great challenges. I was advising to the Credit Committee. On top, I was responsible for controlling of country limits, reporting on excesses, and taking actions to solve them. Again, I was involved in making policies and procedures for the Country Limit Desk. And I was further participating in various system-related projects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Country Risk Analyst

profile_positions.description: I was analyzing, assessing and reviewing credit and country risks of financial institutions in emerging markets. I was writing advices for Credit Committee meetings, I attended the meetings, and I was making the minutes. Yet, it was the year after the Asian crisis, and we had mostly only trade-related deals and annual reviews. I wanted more challenges. And after I came back from New York where I attended a "Counterparty and Country Risk Analysis" training, a few months later I started working in Country Risk Desk.
profile_positions.title: Credit Risk Analyst Financial Institutions

profile_positions.description: I was analyzing financials (balance sheet, income statement and cash flow) of corporates and individuals. In cooperation with account managers (commercial), I was assessing credit, management, industry and market risks, whether they were well mitigated, and then I was advising to the Credit Committee, and attending the meetings and making minutes. As a followup, I was checking loan agreements whether they were in line with Credit Committee approval. I was also verifying if the loan and other data were properly input in the system. I was monitoring on excesses on accounts and making various reports, also to the Head Office in Amsterdam. Finally, I was updating various procedures and participated in different projects. This was an amazing job with variety of roles and responsibilities. I learnt and grew a lot. One year after I was promoted to Senior Credit Risk Analyst, I was promoted to Lending Risk Manager. However, I never started this position, because I left for the Netherlands, for love, a man who I met one year earlier when I was sent to the Head Office in Amsterdam for an exchange program.
profile_positions.title: (Officer) Senior Credit Risk Analyst

profile_positions.description: After over a year working at ING, I was promoted to the Head of Nostro / Loro Section, within the Accounting Department. I enjoyed to manage a team of five people. I was responsible for the investigation of discrepancies, any items that were not reconciled on nostro and loro accounts. I was also involved in many system-related projects. However, I wanted to grow further and do trainings. I went to New Zealand for two months, and after I came back, we had a new Head, and I started working in Credit Risk Management Department as an Officer.
profile_positions.title: Head of Nostro / Loro Section

profile_positions.description: This was my first full time job after I graduated from the university. I was responsible for the reconciliation of nostro and loro accounts.
profile_positions.title: Clerk in Back Office

volunteer_experiences.description:
As of September 2019 I am a Partner Trainer within ACCESS and give workshops for volunteers. As of March 2020 I also volunteer as a Manager of Community Education Department (CED), I oversee and manage the department. I organize and conduct quarterly meeting with ACCESS Trainers Network (ATN). I attend monthly Management Team meetings. I recommend any improvements if needed for the CED. Together with Operations Manager we manage the recruitment process of new trainers. I suggest new courses. I am the contact person between ATN and other departments in ACCESS.

ACCESS is a non-profit foundation that for over 30 years helps newcomers in the Netherlands to adapt smoothly. ACCESS takes care also for the spouses. ACCESS, together with their numerous volunteers and partners, advises on housing, finances, health, schools, childbirth, coaching, and more.

volunteer_experiences.role: Commissioner, Event Manager, Master of Ceremony

company.name: Polish Professional Women in the Netherlands

volunteer_experiences.description:
I enjoy all the meetings organized Polish Professional Women in the Netherlands (PPW), and as a commissioner (komisarka), I hosted events.

PPW is a non-profit organization inspiring and empowering Polish Women in the Netherlands. PPW supports both personal and professional development. PPW organizes numerous events on variety of topics, some internal in Polish and some public in English.

volunteer_experiences.role: Consul in the Global Personal Development Group
volunteer_experiences.description: I organize and host events that help the members of the organization with their personal development. I am also a guest speaker in various events about how to rediscover yourself, how how to discover your strengths and potential, how to find your direction, your purpose in life, how to create your inner happiness, why we should embrace failure, and more. On the way to happiness and success!
